description: Borrowed from Latin puerperium (“childbed, childbirth”), from puerpera (“woman in labor or childbed”) +‎ -ium (nominal suffix), from puerperus (“parturient, bringing forth children”), from puer (“child, boy”) +‎ pariō (“to bring forth, bear”) +‎ -us (adjectival suffix).

entries.meaning: (obstetrics) The period of time lasting around a month immediately following childbirth, when the mother’s uterus shrinks back to its prepartum state.
